content:
Combat Changes allow you do change different values of rollData - object that is passed as a data source for fields in roll.

Available fields and commands

You can change any field in roll data. You can either *replace* the field value or add a number (that can be retrieved by roll) to it. As you are directly manipulating roll data, you will get only final value in roll box unless you use one of provided special fields. $fieldName - Replaces value fieldName - Adds roll result to the value

Special fields

Combat Rolls

featClBonus - Bonus to Caster Level (accepts numbers, evaluated and combined)
featSpellDCBonus - Bonus to spell DC (accepts numbers, evaluated and combined)
featDamageBonus - Bonus to damage roll (accepts numbers, affected by critical hits, evaluated and combined)
featAttackBonus - Bonus to attack roll (accepts numbers or fields, evaluated and combined)
&featDamagPrecision - Bonus precision damage (accepts numbers and dice rolls, *not* affected by critical hits by default)
&featDamage.[Type (eg. Fire)] - Bonus damage of type (accepts numbers and dice rolls, *not* affected by critical hits by default)

Defense Rolls

featAC - Bonus to AC (accepts numbers or fields, evaluated and combined)

Saving Throw Rolls

featSavingThrow - Bonus to saving throw roll (accepts numbers or fields, evaluated and combined)
